DataElement.preferredName: Patient Documented Gilbert Syndrome Or Elevated Total Bilirubin Measurement Due To Leukemic Cell Infiltration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the patient meets the eligibility requirements for participating in a clinical trial with regards to documented GilbertÂ’s syndrome or elevated bilirubin due to leukemic infiltration.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Documented Gilbert Syndrome Or Elevated Total Bilirubin Measurement Due To Leukemic Cell Infiltration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation._An autosomal recessive inherited disorder characterized by unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia, resulting in harmless intermittent jaundice._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Raised or increased above normal levels or limits._The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test._Caused by or resulting from._Malignant hematopoietic cell originating in the clonal proliferation of myeloid or lymphoid precursor that undergoes an aberrant and poorly regulated process of organogenesis resulted in arrested maturation and cell capacity for unlimited self-renewal._The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI)_Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Documented Gilbert Syndrome Or Elevated Total Bilirubin Measurement Due To Leukemic Cell Infiltration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.:An autosomal recessive inherited disorder characterized by unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia, resulting in harmless intermittent jaundice.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.:The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test.:Caused by or resulting from.:Malignant hematopoietic cell originating in the clonal proliferation of myeloid or lymphoid precursor that undergoes an aberrant and poorly regulated process of organogenesis resulted in arrested maturation and cell capacity for unlimited self-renewal.:The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI):Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.
An autosomal recessive inherited disorder characterized by unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia, resulting in harmless intermittent jaundice.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.

The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test.

Malignant hematopoietic cell originating in the clonal proliferation of myeloid or lymphoid precursor that undergoes an aberrant and poorly regulated process of organogenesis resulted in arrested maturation and cell capacity for unlimited self-renewal.
The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI)
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have documented
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have documented Gilbert's syndrome or elevated bilirubin believed by investigator to be due to leukemic infiltration?
